column4: Hi, how can I protect Linux from Windows ? I'm multibooting, and I think If Windows goes crazy, it can format my Linux partition.
unlikely in the utmost extreme
sorry but i cant understand you, my bad english.. can you simple it for me ? :)
will not happen.
oh, how can u sure :) I think windows is a killer.
smp support
SMP ?
dual core etc
Can I stop SMP in my 2.6.24 ?
I think it causes random segfaults.
that sounds unlikely
If I send you my bug report, can you explain it for me ?
The segfault problem is started with hardy.
Is Ubuntu have any kernels like : 2.6.24-xx-386 ?
aye
can you give me packets name ?
and heres my bug report: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/222782 :)
if you look in synaptic under kernel or 386 it is there
I'm using 32bit 8.04 in my core2duo. can you suggest me 386 or generic ?
core2duo works fine here with generic; the 386 will only see one core
:S But whats the reason of the random segfaults, I cant understand it.
full reinstall needed
